page.title: 07THE BEACH
page.content: The beach at Buck's Mills is popular with families during the Summer because it is safe.Though mostly boulders,at low tide patches of sand appear and there are numerous rock pools.There is a disadvantage in that a sewage outfall pipe discharges into the sea.The Cabin,a small cottage by the slipway,owns the foreshore rights and winches which are let for a peppercorn rent.Clovelly Estate Company own foreshore rights below the at Clovelly for approximately 1.5kms to the east.There are 2 disused lime kilns at Buck's Mills.There is a gore made of boulders running out to sea to the east of the Lower Bight of Fernham.At low tide it is used by fishermen.
